Function.FunctionDescription:
The presence of this function is conditional; it is required for FBlocks that contain a source. This property gives particulars about the type of streaming data a source can handle. If notification is used for an FBlock with multiple sources, multiple notifications will be sent when the status changes for more than one source.
For further information please refer to the MOST Stream Transmission Specification Rev 3.0.

PUParam.ParamDescription:
Number of transferred bytes per MOST frame.

Speed gradeParameter value range
MOST501...117
MOST1501...372

Connection identifier. If no bandwidth was allocated yet, 0x0000 must be used.

Speed gradeParameter value range
MOST500; 11...127
MOST1500; 12...383
The parameter depends on the used content type.

StreamParam.ParamDescription: Resolution of the audio samples in bytes.
SpeedFactor defines the speed factor of the content with respect to the transmission.

Connection identifier of the SAD associated stream. If no bandwidth was allocated yet, 0x0000 must be used.

Speed gradeParameter value range
MOST500; 11...127
MOST1500; 12...383
The parameter depends on the used transmission class.
Describe the channel name and determine the room position of the channel.
Resolution of the audio samples in bits.

ContentType "IP Stream" (0x90) is deprecated!

Length parameter decides if IP_V4 (32bit address) or IP_V6 (128bit) address is used.
  • Length=4 means IP_V4
  • Length=16 means IP_V6

ContentType "IP Stream" (0x90) is deprecated!

Length parameter decides if IP_V4 (32bit address) or IP_V6 (128bit) address is used.
  • Length=4 means IP_V4
  • Length=16 means IP_V6

ContentType "IP Stream" (0x90) is deprecated!

16 bit Port.

PUParam.ParamDescription: Number of a data source (within one FBlock there can be more than one), for example, 0x01 for the first source.
Describe the used MOST transmission type.
The parameter depends on the used transmission class.

StreamParam.ParamDescription:
Number of bytes the original data frame uses.

Note: DataFrameBlockwidth is set to 0x00 for ContentType 0x0F (Phase Information).
Sample frequency of the original data frame in Hz.

Connection label for Phase Information. If no bandwidth was allocated yet, 0x0000 must be used.

Speed gradeParameter value range
MOST500; 11...127
MOST1500; 12...383
The maximum data rate of the original stream in kbit/s.
The maximum data rate of the original stream in kbit/s.

Function.FunctionDescription: The presence of this function is conditional; it is required for FBlocks that contain a source. The Allocate method causes the source to occupy bandwidth for streaming data.

MQParam.ParamDescription: Unique identifier of the requesting task within the device.

Number of transferred bytes per MOST frame.

Speed gradeParameter value range
MOST501...117
MOST1501...372
Number of a data source (within one FBlock there can be more than one), for example, 0x01 for the first source.

Connection identifier.

Speed gradeParameter value range
MOST5011...127
MOST15012...383
Besides the error information provided in the MOST Specification, function specific error info values are specified here.

StreamParam.ParamDescription: Number of a data source (within one FBlock there can be more than one), for example, 0x01 for the first source.

Number of transferred bytes per MOST frame.

Speed gradeParameter value range
MOST501...117
MOST1501...372

Function.FunctionDescription: The presence of this function is conditional; it is required for FBlocks that contain a source. The method DeAllocate causes the source to free occupied Streaming bandwidth.

MQParam.ParamDescription: Unique identifier of the requesting task within the device.
Number of a data source (within one FBlock there can be more than one), for example, 0x01 for the first source.

Function.FunctionDescription: This method controls the activity of a source.

MQParam.ParamDescription: Unique identifier of the requesting task within the device.
Number of a data source (within one FBlock there can be more than one), for example, 0x01 for the first source.
Through parameter Activity, streaming data transfer can be started, stopped, or paused.

Function.FunctionDescription: By property SourceName, an identifier of the streaming source data can be requested. If notification is used for an FBlock with multiple sources, multiple notifications will be sent when the status changes for more than one source.

PUParam.ParamDescription: Number of a data source (within one FBlock there can be more than one), for example, 0x01 for the first source.
